And that’s why there can only be one Bitcoin.

The rules of the protocol say that the chain with the most PoW is Bitcoin. But 3rd parties (exchanges, hedge funds, etc) aren’t legally bound to following that naming requirement. They aren’t going to give up calling the token assigned to their keys “Bitcoin.”
Whoever controls the keys owns the token. Right now that token might be called Bitcoin, but there is no guarantee that it will be called Bitcoin tomorrow.
I do wonder how “Bitcoin” is defined in all of these new financial products that seem to be showing up (hedge funds and whatnot).
The difficulty on the legacy chain can’t be altered without a hardfork. BitcoinCash just hardforked to adjust their difficulty.
